Subsection.Text: “Charitable organization” means an organization described in s. 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and exempt from tax under s. 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code.
“Internal Revenue Code” means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.
“Private foundation trust” means a trust, including a trust described in s. 4947(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code, as defined in s. 509(a) of the Internal Revenue Code.
“Split interest trust” means a trust for individual and charitable beneficiaries that is subject to the provisions of s. 4947(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code.
“State attorney” means the state attorney for the judicial circuit of the principal place of administration of the trust pursuant to s. 736.0108.
